title: Easy Ways to Check If Your PayPal Account Is Closed + Fixes

steps.title: Look for the confirmation email.
steps.content: Look for the confirmation email. When you close your account, PayPal will send you an email. It should confirm that the account has been closed along with instructions on what to do if it was a mistake. Keep in mind that it may be difficult, if not impossible, to recover a closed PayPal account. If the action was recent, PayPal may be able to reverse it.

steps.title: Try to log in using the same credentials as the account you just closed.
steps.content: Try to log in using the same credentials as the account you just closed. Go to https://www.paypal.com/signin and enter your email address. If the account is closed, you should see: "Some of your info isn't correct. Please try again."

steps.title: Use the email recovery page to test your email.
steps.content: Use the email recovery page to test your email. Go to https://www.paypal.com/authflow/email-recovery/ and enter your email address in one of the fields. Select Next . You should see: "We didnâ€™t find an account for any of these emails." If you see this, your account has been successfully deleted from PayPal's database.

steps.title: Open the PayPal app.
steps.content: Open the PayPal app. If you're logged into your account , you should see your home page. [1] X Research source Verify that you're signed into the correct account. Tap the profile icon in the top-right corner. Tap Account info to view your email address and/or phone number connected to your account.

steps.title: Remove any money in your PayPal balance.
steps.content: Remove any money in your PayPal balance. If you have money in your account, or if you have unresolved issues, you won't be able to close your account. Transfer your balance to a connected bank account or another account . It's recommended to wait until your transactions finish processing before closing your account. If you don't use the instant transfer option, it can take 1-3 business days.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. This is in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Close your account.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Close your account . You can find this at the bottom of the page, above Log out .

steps.title: Enter your PayPal password and tap Next.
steps.content: Enter your PayPal password and tap Next . This will confirm your action to close your account.

steps.title: Tap Close your account.
steps.content: Tap Close your account . You may need to enter your email address again to confirm. Once confirmed, your PayPal account will be closed.

steps.title: Go to https://www.paypal.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.paypal.com/ in a web browser. If you're logged into your account, you should see your home page. Verify that you're signed into the correct account. Click the cog icon in the top-right corner. View your email address and/or phone number connected to your account. If it doesn't match, sign out and log in with the correct email.

steps.title: Remove any money in your PayPal balance.
steps.content: Remove any money in your PayPal balance. If you have money in your account, or if you have unresolved issues, you won't be able to close your account. Transfer your balance to a connected bank account or another account. It's recommended to wait until your transactions finish processing before closing your account. If you don't use the instant transfer option, it can take 1-3 business days.

steps.title: Click the cog icon.
steps.content: Click the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner of the page. You'll be redirected to your account settings.

steps.title: Click Close your account.
steps.content: Click Close your account . You can find this at the bottom of the Account options section.

steps.title: Click Close Account.
steps.content: Click Close Account . Verify that your email address is correct in the Primary email field. Your PayPal account will be closed.

steps.title: You have unresolved issues or money in your account.
steps.content: You have unresolved issues or money in your account. Unresolved issues can mean failed payments, open claims, and other account flags. To check, view the Activity tab or your inbox for notifications. If you have money in your account, transfer your balance to your bank account or another PayPal account. If your balance is zero and you still can't close your account, contact PayPal .

steps.title: No, you can't reopen a closed PayPal account.
steps.content: No, you can't reopen a closed PayPal account. Once an account is closed, it is permanently closed. However, you can still create a new account using the same email address. [2] X Research source
